slides.title: Turn Your Venue Into a Destination

content.headline: The Complete Venue Profile Guide
content.subhead: Everything you need to stand out and get booked

expectations.outcome: A venue profile that converts lookers into bookers

slides.narration: If you have a physical location—a restaurant, event space, retail store, fitness studio, anything—this guide is for you. In twenty minutes, you'll have a venue profile that doesn't just show up in searches, but actually gets people through your door. Let's turn your location into a destination.

slides.title: What Makes Venues Stand Out

content.headline: The Venue Profile That Wins

key_elements.impact: Answer every question before they ask
Reviews and past events build trust

content.truth: People book venues they can visualize themselves in.

slides.narration: Here's what makes venues stand out. Professional photos get ten times more engagement than phone snapshots. Complete amenities answer every question before they ask. A virtual tour keeps people on your page three times longer. Clear capacity and pricing means you only get qualified leads. And social proof—reviews and past events—builds trust. The truth is: people book venues they can visualize themselves in.

slides.title: Step 1: Photo Gallery

content.headline: Step 1: Build Your Photo Gallery
content.pro_tip: Hire a photographer. $200-400 investment pays off forever.

slides.narration: Step one: build your photo gallery. You need several types. A hero shot—your best, most impressive angle. Space shots showing different areas and setups. Detail shots of features that make you special. In-use shots of events happening and people enjoying. And exterior shots for finding you. Aim for eight photos minimum, fifteen to twenty is ideal. Pro tip: hire a photographer. Two to four hundred dollars is an investment that pays off forever.

slides.title: Step 2: Complete Your Amenities

content.headline: Step 2: List Every Amenity

amenity_categories.examples: Noise limits, hours, parking, outside vendors

content.tip: Every amenity you add is a search term you can be found by.

slides.narration: Step two: list every amenity. And I mean every one. Space details—capacity, square footage, room types. Technical features—AV equipment, WiFi, power. Comfort—AC, heating, seating, accessibility. Services you offer—catering, setup, cleanup. And policies—noise limits, hours, parking. Here's why this matters: every amenity you add is a search term you can be found by. 'Venue with projector.' 'Space with wheelchair access.' Be findable.

slides.title: Step 3: Pricing & Packages

content.headline: Step 3: Be Clear on Pricing
pricing_tips: Show starting prices even if you customize
Be upfront about deposits and minimums

example_packages.name: Basic
example_packages.includes: Space only, bring your own everything

slides.narration: Step three: be clear on pricing. I know it's tempting to hide prices and force inquiries, but that just annoys people. Show starting prices even if you customize. Create two to three packages for different needs and budgets. List what's included versus what costs extra. Be upfront about deposits and minimums. For complex pricing, add a 'Request Quote' option. Transparency builds trust and saves you time with unqualified leads.

slides.title: Step 4: Social Proof

content.headline: Step 4: Show That Others Trust You
content.request_script: Would you mind sharing your experience? It helps other event planners find us.

slides.narration: Step four: show that others trust you. Collect reviews—request them after every event with a simple message: 'Would you mind sharing your experience? It helps other event planners find us.' Create a past events gallery with photos from previous bookings, with permission. Display client logos if you've hosted companies or organizations. Add any media mentions. Show certifications. Every piece of proof reduces someone's hesitation to book.

slides.title: Step 5: Enable Easy Booking

content.headline: Step 5: Make Booking Frictionless

booking_features.benefit: Capture all info you need upfront

content.warning: Every day you take to respond, you lose 30% of leads.

slides.narration: Step five: make booking frictionless. Enable an availability calendar so people see open dates instantly. Offer instant quotes if your pricing allows. Add one-click tour scheduling for walkthroughs. Create an inquiry form that captures everything you need upfront. And here's a critical one: respond fast. Every day you take to respond, you lose thirty percent of leads. Set up notifications so you never miss an inquiry.

slides.title: Optimize Your Venue
slides.narration: Ready to get booked more? Click 'Optimize My Venue Profile' and we'll walk you through each element. Your checklist: eight-plus professional photos, all amenities listed, clear pricing, reviews and past events, easy booking enabled. Or if you need photos first, schedule a free consult with one of our photography partners. Your venue deserves to be seen. Let's make it irresistible.
